Active.description: Used as the primary active input states and secondary actions such as secondary, subtle, and ghost buttons.

Hover.description: Used as the primary active input states and secondary actions such as secondary, subtle, and ghost buttons.

Disabled.description: Used as the primary active input states and secondary actions such as secondary, subtle, and ghost buttons.

Subtle.description: Used as the primary active input states and secondary actions such as secondary, subtle, and ghost buttons.

Offset.description: Used as the primary active input states and secondary actions such as secondary, subtle, and ghost buttons.

Active.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Hover.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Default.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Inactive.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Subtle.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Offset.description: Used for interactive elements of the lowest-level of hierarchy. Examples include tabs and inactive inputs.

Primary.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Secondary.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Tertiary.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Icon.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Subtle.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Offset.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Background.description: Used as the main colors for neutral elements such as text headers, body copy, icons, etc. that don’t have any interactivity or have states for the user to engage with.

Text.description: Used for the display of neutral or helpful information to users. Gently reminds or hints to users a status or update on the product.

Accent.description: Used for the display of neutral or helpful information to users. Gently reminds or hints to users a status or update on the product.

Background.description: Used for the display of neutral or helpful information to users. Gently reminds or hints to users a status or update on the product.

Text.description: Confirms to the user that a process or status is confirmed or a successful transaction has taken place. Also used to represent positive change in data visualization.

Accent.description: Confirms to the user that a process or status is confirmed or a successful transaction has taken place. Also used to represent positive change in data visualization.

Background.description: Confirms to the user that a process or status is confirmed or a successful transaction has taken place. Also used to represent positive change in data visualization.

Text.description: Cautions the user about the potential for problems or warning users ahead of time that there may be an issue moving forward.

Accent.description: Cautions the user about the potential for problems or warning users ahead of time that there may be an issue moving forward.

Background.description: Cautions the user about the potential for problems or warning users ahead of time that there may be an issue moving forward.

Text.description: Alerts the user that an error has taken place or something went wrong with a process they submitted. Also used to represent a negative change in data visualization.

Accent.description: Alerts the user that an error has taken place or something went wrong with a process they submitted. Also used to represent a negative change in data visualization.

Background.description: Alerts the user that an error has taken place or something went wrong with a process they submitted. Also used to represent a negative change in data visualization.

OverlaySolid.description: Used to display depth through overlays or other types of effects.

OverlayGradient.description: Used to display depth through overlays or other types of effects.

OnPrimary.description: Inverted OnMedia states are used for scenarios where the color contrast of the background fill is too low when using the standard Primary OnMedia swatch.

OnSecondary.description: Inverted OnMedia states are used for scenarios where the color contrast of the background fill is too low when using the standard Primary OnMedia swatch.
